alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:10AM EDT until June 22 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Jefferson County in Big Bend Florida... Taylor County in Big Bend Florida... * Until 915 AM EDT. * At 510 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Perry, Hampton Springs, Perry-Foley Airport, Bucell Junction, Pinland, Foley, Adams Beach, Secotan, Athena, Fenholloway, Dekle Beach, Boyd, Jug Island, Jack Lee Island, Blue Springs, Keaton Beach, Cedar Island, Bird Island, Econfina and Carbur. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
